args: Congrats on your new restaurant, Valerio!\nI am gonna nosh SO hard here!
Thank you. It's a dream come true for me.
We're grateful for the invitation.\nWe haven't had a chance to enjoy\nyour cooking since the Orichalcum Chef.
Your help with that was invaluable.\nI daresay I owe this grand opening to you.
That's why today, the whole of my\nculinary expertise is at your disposal.\nEat, drink, and be merry, friends.
My stomach ain't just rumblin', it's roarin'!\nLet's eat!
So help me, Ranzal, if you don't leave\nme at LEAST ten dinner rolls...
Worry not. I called in a sous chef to\nensure that I could keep pace with your\nappetites.
A sous chef? Wait, you don't mean—
Seriously? THIS clown?! The same\nawful creep who tried to sabotage\nyou at the cooking contest?
I most certainly did not ＂ring,＂ Picaro!\nWhy are you here? To spoil my party\nwith your despicable deeds?
So rude, this one! I heard you'd opened\na restaurant, and as your rival, I figured\nI would honor you with a personal visit.

And now you have. So if you're quite
finished, I believe you had best be getting
on your way. I'm sure your bistro is simply
falling apart in your absence.
Mark my words: I WILL be back, and I\nWILL sample your cuisine! Just be sure\nnot to oversalt, eh? Oho ho ho!
Uh, bye, weirdo. Anyway, if your\nbackup isn't Picaro, then who is it?
Valerio! The soup stock is up!\nJust wait till you get a slurp of THIS!
Oh, your sous chef is Mitsuba!\nWhat's shakin', girl? I haven't seen\nyou since the cooking contest!
Hi, Notte! With me and Valerio working\ntogether, you're in for a culinary\nexperience you'll not soon forget!
Wow. You two are really going all-out.
Oh, man, that smells A-MA-ZING.\nGood to see you two haven't lost\nyour edge! ...Edges? Edges.
This looks spectacular. I suppose I should\nhave expected no less from such illustrious\nchefs.
Alberia truly is a bountiful land.\nNow then, shall we?
Crisps 'n crackers, Valerio! You killed it!\nMan, you really are some kinda genius!
Très bien! ...This is not.\nBut I suppose it's adequate.

I can't believe a former knight can cook
better than me... I've dedicated my whole
life to the culinary arts! Papa trained me
from birth!
Oh, that's right. Valerio was a knight\nbefore he became a cook, wasn't he?
Quite so. As his rival, I've researched him\nextensively. He hails from North Grastaea,\nwhere—
*ahem* Picaro. I've prepared a special\ntasting menu just for you.
For me?! Don't mind if I do!\n*chomp*...
Mmm, yesh, thish is... Mm?\nHmmmm... NNNGHHH?!
Dang. Poor dude's out cold.\nWhat did you give him, Valerio?
An extraordinarily spicy dish I learned\nfrom some Taiwu natives at the castle.
Consider that punishment for digging into\nmy past without permission, Picaro.
Ah, pardon, sir, but the restaurant\nis booked today for a private—
I heard a culinary genius had opened\na new restaurant and was hiring cooks.
You...don't remember me at all, do you?
Have you forgotten everything that\nhappened back then?!
Valerio, what's going on here?\nLet's all take a deep breath and\ntalk this over.
I haven't forgotten a thing.\nHow could I?
Then how could you have the nerve\nto show your face in my restaurant?!\nEnough of this!
Get out! And never darken my door again!
Forgive me, but...I'm closing early today.\nI'm afraid this party is over.
Phew! That's the last dish washed!
Thank you for your help. You go home,\nand I'll finish tidying—
Hold up. You expect us to just\nleave after that kerfuffle earlier?
Talk to us, Valerio. Tell us what\nhappened between you and that guy.
...Very well. I suppose if I can discuss this\nwith anyone, it's you. And I do owe you\nthat much.
This is the story of a man who believed\nthat so long as he held blade in hand,\nhe could protect anything.
It is also the story of a pathetic fool who\nfailed to protect what mattered most...
